What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I really enjoyed the class and learned how to hone my own writing skills.
I learnt how to structure college essays, while at the same time learning how to analyze poetry and prose through a specific (in this case nostalgic) lens.
writing, close reading, and especially my revision skills grew.
I developed analytical skills, as well as essay-writing skills and discussion based skills
My writing and reading comprehension greatly improved in this course. I also have a greater understanding of the complex ways in which authors utilize nostalgia in their works.

I learned a lot about collaboration in writing. I also thought about nostalgia in ways that were so much deeper than I ever thought possible, which really made me contemplate the effect of nostalgia in my own life. I feel that my writing has greatly improved.
The strength was how interactive the course was! I just wish the readings were more interesting.
The peer workshops were the biggest strengths.

Strengths = quickly improved essay writing skills, how to analyze books and texts
Weaknesses = quick pace for readings, discussions sometimes slow and texts often not explained fully if struggling to understand

Strengths- The discussion-based format was key in students development (understanding text, their applications, developing ideas, etc.)
Weaknesses- Though we often were given feedback, I felt that some writing fundamentals should be explored within the course.

The atmosphere of this class was one that I would love to replicate for Yale courses across the board. It was a space where I felt comfortable sharing my thoughts about the literature we read, and the small class size motivated me to stay on top of course readings and analyze things on a deeper level so I could contribute. Some of the readings, however, did not always seem to be related to nostalgia in ways that were apparent. However, the class did prompt me to relate nostalgia to many different concepts and see it in the greater context of the world.
yes! fair workload but challenging class that pushes you to grow.
Yes as it helped essay writing skills and how to analyze texts
I would 100% recommend this course to another student. I not only learned a lot but was fully engaged throughout.

I would recommend this course to another student. It was a good way to study writing in a context that interested me, and the professor was very open to ideas and worked to make the class a good experience.
